newsitem.title: DUBAI: Saudi power shareholders to get $138 mln dividend.
newsitem.headline: Saudi power shareholders to get $138 mln dividend.

text.p: Saudi Arabia will pay a total of 520 million riyals ($138 million) in dividends to shareholders in the majority state-owned electricity sector for 1996, Saudi newspapers said on Sunday.

They quoted Finance and Economy Minister Ibrahim Abdul-Aziz al-Assaf as saying the dividends would ensure the seven percent annual profit on shares that the government guarantees shareholders in the heavily-subsidised sector.
"This (dividend) aims at encouraging citizens to invest in this (electricity) sector," Assaf said.

Saudi Arabia's state-run electricity companies, which charge heavily subsidised, below-cost rates, have for years been suffering heavy losses amid a tight squeeze on spending by the government. Most of them have embarked on huge projects to boost production to meet rising demand in the kingdom.
